CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 8, 1970, pg. 6, reads: "AUBA Cotillion Winners - Youths of the Allegheny Union Baptist Christian Education Congress were presented in a Cotillion when session where held recently at Calvary Baptist Church, Wylie Ave. and Percy Jackson, right, representing Calvary Church, reporting $501 to win the crown. William A. G .Fisher, one of the district workers, crowns the king, while his escort bears the winner's bouquet.  Runner-ups, left to right are, Susie Scott of Metropolitan Baptist, Pittsburgh, who placed third; and Linda Lofton of Morning Star Baptist Church, Erie, Pa., who took second place honors.  Mrs. Delphinia Briscoe, youth director is not in picture.  A total of $1, 692 was raised. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Allegheny Union Baptist Association cotillion winners, including third place Susie Scott, second place Linda Lofton, unknown queen, king Percy Jackson, and William A. G. Fisher holding crown, in Calvary Baptist Church with banner inscribed "The Silent Majority" in background
